cjtb

  • things I'm doing (at January 2025)
    • building a new physics R&D org
    • helping founders tell the truth at Encour, a new kind of strategic comms firm
    • writing at Clarevoyant and also here
    • helping the Australian Government build its quantum industry as a member of the National Quantum Advisory Committee
      • we released Australia's first National Quantum Strategy in 2023, which laid the groundwork for >$1B in investment into quantum things by the Commonwealth and State Governments.
  • my current independent research interests are
    • the various ways we understand schizophrenia (scientific, literary, etc)
    • phenomenology of programs in digital space
    • how we simulate complex (biological) systems and how that can be used to increase the rate/decrease the cost of clinical trials
    • silly little spreadsheet noodlings on building on top of the solar experience/cost curve (a yummy exponential you should be paying attention to)
  • things I've done
    • invested in frontier tech at Blackbird
      • if you are a young person with a creative bent or a passion project, you should check out the Blackbird Foundation's Protostars microgrant program, which is run by Theia Gabatan and Joel Connolly. It's a very special program and community.
    • started and built Foundry, Blackbird's founder dev/preaccelerator program for PhD students and postdocs
    • added some momentum at nonprofit DeadlyScience as first employee.
      • While I was there, the team won the Eureka Prize (Australia's top national STEM award) for STEM Inclusion, thanks largely to the tireless work of Corey Tutt over several years. DeadlyScience does amazing work getting science books and resources to remote Indigenous schools and communities; I believe educational equity is extremely important, and their work deserves support, so you should donate.
    • co-created/led with Genevieve Firmer (legend) the 2021 Harry Messel International Science School's chemistry stream with a workshop, "Is the universe ruled by chaos?"
    • supervised some research projects for advanced undergrads at the University of Sydney (one on the intersection of nanoscience and art, another on Lie algebraic methods in quantum mechanics)
    • a bachelor of advanced science in chemistry and mathematics, with Honours and the University Medal in quantum simulation under Ivan Kassal, at the University of Sydney
      • Ivan is a great researcher and supervisor with a wonderful group
      • a paper related to my hons work
      • in general I really enjoyed my time at the University of Sydney and rate the academics there very highly. It's a great community. I loved being a part of it.
    • was a high school teachers' aide in learning support
